sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
What is the chromatic index of a complete graph K5?

(Note: A complete graph K5 has 5 vertices, and each vertex is connected to every other vertex in the graph.)
message_2:
The chromatic index of a graph is the smallest number of colors needed to color its edges such that no two adjacent edges share the same color.

For a complete graph K_n with n vertices, the chromatic index can be determined using the following formula:

chromatic index = n if n is odd,
chromatic index = n - 1 if n is even.

Since K5 is a complete graph with 5 vertices (which is an odd number), its chromatic index is equal to the number of vertices:

chromatic index = 5
